title: Mystery of the inn by the shore

quoteFirst: There had obviously been a desperate struggle, for the carpet is disarranged, the remains of a vase lie scattered about the floor, and a clock had been knocked off the table. This clock, by the way, furnishes an important clue, for it had stopped at
quoteLast: , showing at what time the murder was committed.”
title:
Clubfoot the Avenger
Being some further adventures of Desmond Oakwood, of the Secret Service
author: Williams, Valentine, 1883-1946

quoteLast: , the Tokyo control operator of the Japanese Broadcasting Corporation noticed that the Hiroshima station had gone off the air. He tried to use another telephone line to reestablish his program, but it too had failed.
title: The Atomic Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki

quoteFirst: Presents the ordinary phenomena of its changes as follows: Full on the 2d, at 1:51 p. m.; last quarter on the 9th, at 6:22 a. m.; new on the 17th, at
quoteLast: ; first quarter on the 25th, at 8:13 a. m. It rises on the 15th, at 6:08 a. m., and sets on the 1st and 30th, at 5:21 a. m. and 5:13 a. m. respectively. Is nearest the earth on the 2d, at 9:30 p.
